topics.author: 5007bbdf7f123b112f00023a

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a035976368724fff00049a#post_55a035976368724fff00049a
[bq="uc9"]You know what I legitimately hate?  Whenever a youtuber has them begging for you to watch them right off the bat and it's as loud as fucking possible to the point you yank your headphones out of the socket in shock; you don't need to make shit *THAT* fucking loud.

"*HEY EVERYONE!  I'M <INSERT HERE>!  MAKE SURE TO LEAVE A LIKE AND FAVORITE AND ENJOY THE VIDEO!*"[/bq]
I agree, I think it's asinine to do this. If people enjoy your content, they'll like and subscribe out of their own ability to do so. Begging your viewers for likes and subscribes feels more to me like you're babying your audience and telling them what to do.

Earn your audience, don't force it.
